intro: Rubus imperialis, commonly known as the imperial raspberry, is a rare and ornamental species within the Rubus genus. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers and edible, deep-red fruits that are highly sought after. The plant typically grows in temperate climates and thrives in well-drained, fertile soils. Its leaves are compound, with three to five leaflets, and its stems are usually thorny. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and specialized horticultural collections.
